## Description {#details}

Helper class to manage the recursive combining of hash&#95;combine arguments.

This class exists to manage the state and various calls involved in the recursive combining of arguments used in hash&#95;combine. It is particularly useful at minimizing the code in the recursive calls to ease the pain caused by a lack of variadic functions.

Definition at line 484 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/hashing-h">Hashing.h</a>.

## Public Constructors

### hash&#95;combine&#95;recursive&#95;helper() {#aed86896537853171897bf29f113e382f}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>llvm::hashing::detail::hash&#95;combine&#95;recursive&#95;helper::hash&#95;combine&#95;recursive&#95;helper ()</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Construct a recursive hash combining helper.

This sets up the state for a recursive hash combine, including getting the seed and buffer setup.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/hashing-h/#l00494">494</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/hashing-h">Hashing.h</a>.

## Public Member Functions

### combine() {#ae78cbf87cf9f0f59522d779be5d49cbb}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;typename T, typename ... Ts&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>hash&#95;code llvm::hashing::detail::hash&#95;combine&#95;recursive&#95;helper::combine (size&#95;t length, char &#42; buffer_ptr, char &#42; buffer_end, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> T &amp; arg, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> Ts &amp;... args)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Recursive, variadic combining method.

This function recurses through each argument, combining that argument into a single hash.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/hashing-h/#l00543">543</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/hashing-h">Hashing.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### combine() {#a3f4bcef234eab8fcdd8e4496777e5a9b}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>hash&#95;code llvm::hashing::detail::hash&#95;combine&#95;recursive&#95;helper::combine (size&#95;t length, char &#42; buffer_ptr, char &#42; buffer_end)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Base case for recursive, variadic combining.

The base case when combining arguments recursively is reached when all arguments have been handled. It flushes the remaining buffer and constructs a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/hash-code">hash&#95;code</a>.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/hashing-h/#l00556">556</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/hashing-h">Hashing.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### combine&#95;data() {#a87cb33524db506474a9207907036a397}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;typename T&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>char &#42; llvm::hashing::detail::hash&#95;combine&#95;recursive&#95;helper::combine&#95;data (size&#95;t &amp; length, char &#42; buffer_ptr, char &#42; buffer_end, T data)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Combine one chunk of data into the current in-flight hash.

This merges one chunk of data into the hash. First it tries to buffer the data. If the buffer is full, it hashes the buffer into its <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/hashing/detail/hash-state">hash&#95;state</a>, empties it, and then merges the new chunk in. This also handles cases where the data straddles the end of the buffer.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/hashing-h/#l00504">504</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/hashing-h">Hashing.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>
